We're thrilled to welcome Dr. Martin Stervander to the Cresko Lab as our newest postdoctoral researcher!

Martin brings extensive expertise in evolutionary biology and genomics to our team. His arrival marks an exciting expansion of our research capabilities and international collaborations.

## Background and Expertise

Martin joins us with:
- Strong background in evolutionary genomics
- Experience with avian systems
- Expertise in population genetics
- Skills in bioinformatics and data analysis
- International research perspective

## Research Fellowship

Martin's position is supported by:
- Swedish Research Council fellowship (2016)
- International mobility grant
- Collaborative research funding
- Cross-disciplinary initiatives
- Global research networks

## Research Interests

Martin will focus on:
- Population genomics of model organisms
- Evolutionary adaptation mechanisms
- Comparative genomics approaches
- Method development for genomic analyses
- International collaborative projects

## Strengthening International Ties

This appointment enhances:
- Sweden-US research collaboration
- European research connections
- Global scientific exchange
- Cross-cultural perspectives
- International funding opportunities

## Expected Contributions

Martin will contribute to:
- Ongoing stickleback genomics projects
- Development of new analytical pipelines
- Mentorship of graduate students
- Grant writing initiatives
- Publication of high-impact research

## Lab Integration

Martin's arrival brings:
- Fresh perspectives on evolution
- New technical approaches
- Expanded collaborative networks
- Enhanced mentoring capacity
- Increased research productivity

## Future Directions

With Martin on board, we anticipate:
- New research directions
- Expanded international collaborations
- Novel analytical approaches
- Increased publication output
- Enhanced training opportunities

Welcome to Eugene and the Cresko Lab, Martin! We look forward to the exciting science ahead.
